data.title: 2021 in Films: 365 Days, 883 Films, and a Year Full of Cinema!
data.meta_description: Having spent all of this year working as a freelance writer, I was privileged enough to have a lot more time on my hands again plus I attended several film festivals (in person and virtually), which in turn led towards watching an absurd amount of new-to-me films. Those interested in my rewatching habits: mind your…
data.meta_site_name: the diary of a film history fanatic
data.text:
Having spent all of this year working as a freelance writer, I was privileged enough to have a lot more time on my hands again plus I attended several film festivals (in person and virtually), which in turn led towards watching an absurd amount of new-to-me films. Those interested in my rewatching habits: mind your own business! As always after the cut you’ll find all 883 new-to-me films I watched, a separate list of all the films directed by women I watched this year, and then my 24 favorite new-to-me watches of the year. Enjoy!

I didn’t quite keep up with a 50/50 ratio of films directed by women, but I did watch several hundred this year and truly every year I discover more and more older films directed by women and brings me such joy. Streaming services like Criterion Channel and programmers at places like UCLA have really done a great job of bringing a lot of forgotten filmmakers to the foreground. Forever grateful.

Lastly, here are my favorite first time watches (not counting “new” releases) that I watched in 2021. Most of these I already wrote about in my monthly wrap-ups, but just wanted to shout these out one last time.

Matewan, 1987 (dir. John Sayles)

Moscow on the Hudson, 1984 (dir. Paul Mazursky)

The Cobweb, 1955 (dir. Vincente Minnelli)

Danzón, 1991 (dir. María Novaro)

Compensation, 1999 (dir. Zeinabu irene Davis)

Jazz on a Summer’s Day, 1959 (dir. Aram Avakian & Bert Stern)

Golden Eighties, 1986 (dir. Chantal Akerman)

Indiscreet, 1958 (dir. Stanley Donen)

7p., cuis., s. de b., … à saisir, 1984 (dir. Agnès Varda)

The Trip to Bountiful, 1985 (dir. Peter Masterson)

The Loveless, 1981 (dir. Kathryn Bigelow & Monty Montgomery)

Lovers and Lollipops, 1956 (dir. Morris Engel & Ruth Orkin)

The Plastic Dome of Norma Jean, 1966 (dir. Juleen Compton)

Bamboozled, 2000 (dir. Spike Lee)

Looking for Mr. Goodbar, 1977 (dir. Richard Brooks)

Bad Girls Go to Hell, 1965 (dir. Doris Wishman)

Working Girls, 1986 (dir. Lizzie Borden)

The Solid Gold Cadillac, 1956 (dir. Richard Quine)

Black Is … Black Ain’t, 1994 (dir. Marlon Riggs)

Chameleon Street, 1989 (dir. Wendell B. Harris Jr.)

Deep Cover, 1992 (dir. Bill Duke)

Possession, 1981 (dir. Andrzej Żuławski)

The Assignation, 1953 (dir. Curtis Harrington)

Diary of a Mad Housewife, 1970 (dir. Frank Perry)
